intro: Phlomoides transjordanica, commonly known as Jordanian blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh climates. It produces small, blue to purple flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss in dry conditions.
